org.sd.text
Class MultiTermFinder

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.text.MultiTermFinder

public class MultiTermFinder
extends java.lang.Object

Term finding utility for finding combinations of terms in text.

This works using LogicalExpression instances, TermFinderTruthFunctions, and returns TermFinderLogicalResults.

Author:
Spence Koehler

static MultiTermFinder loadFromFile(java.io.File multiDefFile)
          Load a MultiTermFinder from a definition file with the following format: Blank lines and lines beginning with '#' are ignored as formatting and comments. Lines beginning with '%' contain a logical expression string (after the %). Lines beginning with '$' contain [caseSensitive] and [matchFlag] (space delimited) to begin definition of a term finder as referenced by logical expression(s) and are followed by lines with comma-delimited terms (ignoring blank lines and comments) and/or lines beginning with '@' which reference a file with terms to load. All terms are considered to be included in a term finder until another '$' or EOF is encountered.

Method Detail

getExpressions

Get expressions stored with this term finder.

evaluateLogicalExpression

public java.util.List<LogicalResult<java.lang.String>> evaluateLogicalExpression(java.lang.String expressionString,
                                                                                 java.lang.String inputString)
Evaluate the expression string against the input using this instance's finders.

See LogicalExpression's constructor and tests for info.

Note that some convenience constants are present in this class as examples and that the possible expressions are not limited to the constants.

Note that the return value can be used to build an "explanation" for the match, but the presence or absence of a match is indicated by a non-null or null response, respectively.

Returns:
null if the expression fails to match the input; otherwise, a non-null list of matching TermFinderLogicalResult instances.

findFirstMatch

public java.util.List<LogicalResult<java.lang.String>> findFirstMatch(java.lang.String inputString)
Find the first matching expression from this instance's expressions to the given input string.

getFinderIndex

public int getFinderIndex(TruthFunction<java.lang.String> truthFunction)

loadFromFile

public static final MultiTermFinder loadFromFile(java.io.File multiDefFile)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
Load a MultiTermFinder from a definition file with the following format:
  • Blank lines and lines beginning with '#' are ignored as formatting and comments.
  • Lines beginning with '%' contain a logical expression string (after the %).
  • Lines beginning with '$' contain [caseSensitive] and [matchFlag] (space delimited) to begin definition of a term finder as referenced by logical expression(s) and are followed by lines with comma-delimited terms (ignoring blank lines and comments) and/or lines beginning with '@' which reference a file with terms to load.
    • All terms are considered to be included in a term finder until another '$' or EOF is encountered.
Note that logical expressions denote term finders by 0-based index in the order they appear in the file. That is, the first '$' section defines term finder 0, the next '$' section defines term finder 1, and so on.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

main

public static final void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                       throws java.io.IOException

java.io.IOException
